xml.title: The Oov Machine
xml.author: Bryant O'Hara
xml.preface: Travel only with thy equals or thy betters; if there are none, travel alone. - The Dhammapada
xml.beat: Bah! None of us are traveling alone -
Gaia is spinning - she does a little dance for us all.
The ones who know this try to keep time -
The dervishes know this in their bones and dance
Scientists know this to the nanosecond and dance
You hear this now but may not know this.
You hear this now but may not know this,
We are all in the same ball falling through the universe, missing an imaginary ground.
There is a rhythm to it,
as the weighing of an anchor.
Listen! Not to the slamming, not to the anchors, not to the chains,
but to the bubbles...and the rumbles...
they are the base... that creates the lather
with which we bathe the future,
with which we build the rhythm
and makes our little star dance...
and makes our little world dance
and makes the ones who know this...
Remember, ignorant one, listen to them - the convector howlers -
